headline: Easy Coleslaw Dressing
description: For a coleslaw recipe that's creamy and delicious, toss this easy-to-make, 5-minute homemade dressing with a bag of store-bought coleslaw mix.

video.description: A simple and creamy coleslaw dressing that uses what you already have!
video.name: Easy Coleslaw Dressing

name: Easy Coleslaw Dressing

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, vinegar, pepper, and salt together in a bowl until smooth and creamy.

review.reviewBody: Loved it! Definitely 5 starts! I followed it to the T with 2 added ingredients. I added a half teaspoon of celery seed and 1 and 1/2 tablespoons of spicy brown mustard since I was piling the slaw high on pastrami sandwiches! It turned out perfect!
I have tried many different dressings and have used this one for a while now. Thought I should write a review since we love this one! Always satisfied, quick and delicious.
Dressing is perfect as listed. I added a little extra mayo, yellow mustard, sweet pickle relish, and agave nectar instead of white sugar. Still 5 stars.
This recipe was super easy to follow and tastes super good. I added a little bit of garlic powder, onion powder, and cajun seasoning to add a little extra umph and it tastes absolutely delicious.
Followed recipe to the letter. It was great. Husband loved it.
Did not alter. I loved it!
It's perfect the way it is. My family lived it. Thank you for sharing.

Great base for the dressing. Liked that it recommended lemon juice. I used lime juice instead. I also increased the mayo to 1 cup and added fennel seeds and dill. Fantastic! Dont be afraid to tweak it with your favorite spices
Great dressing!!!
This is a very good, basic, old fashion Coleslaw mix. No frills, no fancy creams, just basic ingredients most have in their homes. Good and simple and excellent just the way it is.
Easy to make. Delicious... as is!

Perfection! I tripled this recipe for a large batch of coleslaw. I substituted 1/2 cup of miracle whip to 2/1/2 cups of mayo. I used malt vinegar & instead of salt, added McCormick salad supreme using the same measurements that the recipe called for. DELICIOUS! üòã Even people who don't care for coleslaw liked it.
Love the flavors -I use 4-5 packets Stevia, to taste-Fabulous!!!!
No changes It is Great easy fast
This is the perfect coleslaw dressing recipe. I have made it dozens of times, and it is the only one I‚Äôll ever need again.
Excellent flavor
I've made this 3 times now, after discovering this easy recipe and my family loves it.

Since the first time I used this recipe I knew I'd never use another. This has the perfect blend of tart with the perfect level of sweet. We eat this dressing (coleslaw) with smoked bbq pork for tacos or sliders, and it is delicious as a side. It is fantastic! You will not be disappointedüòã
Easy and fresh tasting
Perfect and easy!
Excellent base recipe or as is!

Very easy and simple. I reduced the sugar(diabetic),but,it was still good. I also didn't have lemon,but,I really don't care for lime/ lemon in my food,so,I didn't miss it.I like adding malt vinegar to my own plate of slaw. I had been looking for something simple like this. Thank you for sharing it.Oh,I also add raisins to my coleslaw.
Very good!! No changes
Really good coleslaw dressing. I have been looking for a recipe like this that doesn't overwhelm the slaw.

Super easy and delicious! I added 1 TBS of horseradish sauce and zest of 1 lemon before squeezing for the juice. Update, my husband said he will only eat my coleslaw in the future; best he ever had. My son who doesn't eat vegetables even liked it. We were shocked he ate it.
We loved this,
Easy and taste so good. Will be my go to for coleslaw from mow on.
So tasty!! I reduced the sugar a bit and added some homemade relish to use it up. Delicious!! üòÄ
Fantastic!!! No need to purchase the all ready made at the grocery store.
Great recipe! Perfect. I had to stretch it a bit with double mayo and it was really incredible!
I made this slaw dressing tonight for a dinner of BBQ pulled pork and it was delicious! We loved it & was so easy to make. Love it!

I love this coleslaw recipe. So easy, I always have the ingredients in the house and it tastes delicious. I usually add a sprinkle of celery seed in it too but it isn‚Äôt necessary, just a flavor my family enjoys.

Very similar to how mom used to make, except we always added celery seed to it, so I did as well. I had no lemon juice or lemons, but never used them before, so went without, and where I usually use white vinegar I used apple cider....I have to say I prefer the white vinegar... But quick and easy, Mom never wrote hers down and while I knew what went in I did not know how much, so looked up this recipe that was closest... serving with baked trout for dinner.
Easy quick inexpensive delicious, I think this said it's for coleslaw, but I used it for my regular salads. Even my picky eaters like it! Thanks!
Easy and tastes good. Almost as easy as opening a jar of Marie's!
Easy Peasy!! Delicious too!!
Very tasty and just enough to wet the 14 oz of cabbage.
Easy and tasty! But most of all EASY and FAST. The recipe is a keeper.
This was a very good recipe with modifications. I used the above dressing with only one cup of the cabbage and carrot mix. I didn‚Äôt use any vinegar and just a pinch of sugar to offset the lemon.
Add a little horse radish to give it a kick
this is the recipe my mother always used and its the best,, coleslaw dressing ever,
Great recipe! I use homemade apple cider vinegar and add a teaspoon of celery seeds to mine. I also finely chop up a small green apple to add some zing to my coleslaw. I'm just one of those.
easy and tasted great ! tasted even better after 2 hs in the fridge !

I usually buy Cole slaw dressing but never again. This is easy, ingredients on hand. Yes, I may have tweaked it a little bit with more pepper and some celery seed, but it was good just the way it was presented in recipe!

I like this and only added more pepper to the dressing. I usually double the dressing and reserve a quarter cup to add later.. this would be for a large head of cabbage with carrot and raisin.... Simple and good .... Thanks for this one..
I used only 1 tablespoon sugar and added celery seeds. It's delicious üòã
Amazingly simple and oh so good. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing!
Good base to a dressing was even better with a little bit more lemon, and added some dill mustard. Also I used apple cider vinegar opposed to white.

I used 1/2 head of cabbage that I grated and chopped. Upped the mayo by another 1/4 cup and added 1/4 to 1/2 tsp poppy seeds. Was really good. (upped the mayo as I found it a bit tart for my taste before)
Tried and true recipe. I used two tablespoons of Braggs Apple Cider vinegar instead of lemon and it was still excellent! Thx
This is by far way better than any other slaw dressing I ever made or had. Love it!!
I just made this, only thing I did was used half the salt and pepper. Never added lemon before. This is definitely a keeper.
Really good and easy!!!! ++++

Excellent recipe. I'd never added lemon juice to the coleslaw dressing I made before but was pleasantly surprised with the extra tang it gave to the flavor. The 30 people that ate the coleslaw agreed!
Needed a quick coleslaw dressing for a pulled pork sandwich and this was both quick and delicious. Have a lot left for fish tacos this week.
This is fantastic!! I‚Äôve made it many times and always double it and use two bags of slaw mix. Wish I could give it 100 stars!
This one works!
I have made this several times using this recipe. It is very delicious!

Added: Celery seed, smoked paprika, honey, garlic salt, MUSTARD. Used apple -and- white vinegar. It's delicious. Sweet but also tangy and flavorful. Make 2x if you want heavy coating on a 16oz bag of premix. Don't use a lot of mustard and don't use the cheap stuff.
Used a head of shredded cabbage with some sweet onion and craisons. Could use less pepper maybe
Oh my gosh this was delicious! Thank you ‚ò∫
Oh yum ! Substituted lime juice because that's what I had. Nice twist !
This is the best, easiest coleslaw dressing. The ingredients are always on hand, nothing complicated. I'll never buy bottled again
I used half the sugar and it still tasted quite sweet. I‚Äôll try 1 tsp next time.
Very good nothing fancy just good old cole slaw exactly what I wanted. Try it I think you will enjoy
It's a good recipe! It's not really fair to give it a lower rating simply because it could be better with some added ingredients.
taste delicious
Used 1 tsp sugar instead of 2 T as we prefer it not so sweet. Didn't have lemon juice so used 2 T of apple cider vinegar. Not as good as with lemon juice, but still good.
Great taste; easy to make with pantry staples.
My husband and I love it as do my friends! They all ask for the recipe.

Very good, use it for ratios I forget about. Never put in salt. Used maple syrup rather than sugar. Making waffle chicken sandwiches. 2 waffles, fried chicken breast, cole slaw. Also used Napa cabbage instead
This was easy and excellent! Fed the family of 4!

This recipe was fantastic. My whole family loved it. I only substituted Splenda for the sugar (to our taste - was not the same measurement) but it still tasted exactly like what we all remember the perfect cole slaw tasted like üòç
I make this often and use vegan mayo. Hellmans is good. Today I served it on a roll with a vegan sausage patty topped a slice of vegan cheese, melted. So good and so easy to make.

We're isolated disable senior shut-ins with no transportation that can no longer handle lettuce salads. For the last 50 years, I've only had Winco's deli coleslaw to go with their rotisserie chicken. I gambled on buying Walmart's packaged tri-color coleslaw with their grocery delivery & chopped it in the blender. I dressed it with this recipe and my partner loved it. I didn't like it until it sat in the fridge for a day. It got even better the next few days. I'm so grateful to be able to have salads again & will always have some of this on hand.
Tasted it on finger, delish!!! Thank you

I made the recipe exactly as it was written and it was fantastic! Very simple to make and yes, I did already have all of the ingredients. I have made it multiple times and didn't feel the need to add or subtract to it.
I've made this many times - exactly as is except I add a 1/2 tsp of celery seeds. It's delish!
I love this coleslaw dressing! My family raves about it when I take it to dinners. I add a bit of celery seed, but otherwise I don't change the recipe.
Very good, simple recipe. Thank you for sharing!

Excellent! I have made this dressing a few times. It‚Äôs easy, quick and delicious. I use apple cider vinegar and squeeze fresh lemon juice. I prefer to refrigerate overnight or for at least a few hours to let everything marinate, before serving.
This was so yummy, I used my ninja to chop up the cabbage and carrots cannot say enough how good it was. Definitely never getting store bought again.
Just right, not too much mayonnaise. Quick to throw together!
My family loved just as the recipe directed.
Skip the sugar and use apple cider vinegar
This was so yummy. I used honey instead of sugar. Fabulous! Thank you.
Followed recipe exactly...DELICIOUS!!
Delicious
NO more paying way too much for bottled Cole Slaw Dressing or searching the grocery for where they hide it! Make your own! SO tasty! I love how you can taste the lemon with every bite! TOO Awesome!
Made it exactly as written. This is a reciipe my Mom gave me and I had loet the written copy...thought I remembered it but was glad to find it on Allecipes, Thanks for submitting!

This is a great dressing. It‚Äôs very easy to make. . Even some family members that don‚Äôt like mayonnaise based dressing love it. I used it with a 12 oz pkg of broccoli slaw and it was a good consistency not too creamy or runny.
Delicious. Butter then store bought! !
It tastes very good! Just the way I like it! Very easy to prepare! I use this every time we barbecue!!

Easy and tasty. I added carrot Slices and chopped apples. Used half vegan mayo and plain Greek yogurt. I also, used Stevie instead of sugar, but use half the amount; since Syria is sweeter than sugar and finer.
If you want a real treat, add about a half of a cup of raisins
Very tasty and easy to make. üòã

We made it: perfect, easy and delicious without uncommon ingredients - we did add fresh lemon as stated, we put celery seed which was not included here but we love it - some may not - also if liked - add some pepitas (pumpkin seeds). Thanks.
Fast, easy - I was short on mayo, so substituted 1/4 c 5% plain greek yogurt and the result was great. I often throw together a slaw recipe that is TOO sweet...this is just right.
Make it all the time for my senior residents they love it
